channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Here's why an Arizona medical examiner is working to track heat-related deaths
item.description: No one across the U.S. is consistently tracking climate-fueled deaths. One medical examiner has a new protocol on heat-deaths.
item.content:encoded:
No one across the U.S. is consistently tracking climate-fueled deaths. One medical examiner has a new protocol on heat-deaths.

(Image credit: Cassidy Araiza for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: Apple debuts AI features; how plastics became ingrained in our lives
item.description: Apple announced several new AI features and a partnership with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI at its Worldwide Developers Conference. How the plastic industry ingrained the material into our lives — and what activists are trying to do about it.
item.content:encoded:
Apple announced several new AI features and a partnership with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI at its Worldwide Developers Conference. How the plastic industry ingrained the material into our lives — and what activists are trying to do about it.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Wild elephants may have names that other elephants use to call them
item.description: Research on the rumbles of wild elephants suggest that these animals address each other with unique, name-like vocalizations. (Story aired on All Things Considered on June 10, 2024.)
item.content:encoded: Research on the rumbles of wild elephants suggest that these animals address each other with unique, name-like vocalizations. (Story aired on All Things Considered on June 10, 2024.)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: In the Israeli-occupied West Bank, Palestinians are living their lives -- anxiously
item.description: Palestinians living in Ramallah, the West Bank's largest city, say they are trapped, unable to travel because of settler violence and checkpoints.
item.content:encoded: Palestinians living in Ramallah, the West Bank's largest city, say they are trapped, unable to travel because of settler violence and checkpoints.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: Democratic members of Congress say Supreme Court is embroiled in an 'ethics crisis'
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) about alleged ethics violations at the Supreme Court.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) about alleged ethics violations at the Supreme Court.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: What's next up for the Supreme Court? Abortion rights, gun laws and more
item.description: The Supreme Court will be issuing major rulings in the next month. Normally by this point in the term there are between four and six really big cases left. This year, there are over a dozen.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court will be issuing major rulings in the next month. Normally by this point in the term there are between four and six really big cases left. This year, there are over a dozen.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: How 2 unexpected wars are defining Biden's presidency
item.description: President Biden pulled U.S. troops out of Afghanistan and showed no desire for other military adventures. But the unexpected wars in Ukraine and Gaza have become defining issues of his presidency.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden pulled U.S. troops out of Afghanistan and showed no desire for other military adventures. But the unexpected wars in Ukraine and Gaza have become defining issues of his presidency.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: U.S. citizens detained abroad still face tax fines. Lawmakers want to change that
item.description: The number of Americans who are wrongfully detained abroad has increased in the last decade. If they’re able to return to the U.S, they face bureaucratic hurdles to getting their lives back on track.
item.content:encoded:
The number of Americans who are wrongfully detained abroad has increased in the last decade. If they’re able to return to the U.S, they face bureaucratic hurdles to getting their lives back on track.

(Image credit: Brendan Hoffman)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Once underdogs in the presidential race, Haley voters could now be kingmakers
item.description: Many of Nikki Haley's voters wanted an alternative to Biden and Trump. But now, these potential swing voters have to choose between the two men, again.
item.content:encoded:
Many of Nikki Haley's voters wanted an alternative to Biden and Trump. But now, these potential swing voters have to choose between the two men, again.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Apple doubles down on artificial intelligence, announcing partnership with OpenAI
item.description: Apple has announced a much-anticipated partnership with OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT. The deal to bring AI features to iPhones and other devices is a major move for Apple, which has been slower than some competitors to jump on the AI bandwagon.
item.content:encoded:
Apple has announced a much-anticipated partnership with OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT. The deal to bring AI features to iPhones and other devices is a major move for Apple, which has been slower than some competitors to jump on the AI bandwagon.

(Image credit: Jeff Chiu/AP)
item.dc:creator: Lola Murti
